page.title: 05Farming and Industry
page.content: Farming is{not a major activity}in the area. Most of the land is used for industry. The land that is used for farming is{owned by the large oil } {refineries}and rented out to two farmers, one from Kelsey and one from Stallingborough this land is used for growing{wheat and barley}with some field used for{grazing cattle.}It is a strange sight to see this farmland so close to the industries. Much of the land was once marsh and has been drained for farm use but in recent years industry has taken over. There is however one farmer who actually lives in the area and farms the land for himself. George Tuplin has 9 acres in a narrow strip along Station Road. His farm is a smallholding rather than a farm.
